intro: Ilex yurumanguinis, commonly known as the Yurumanguí holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the humid lowland forests of northern South America, particularly in Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, dark berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Ilex yurumanguinis grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
